availability.p: The text of the original item is in the public domain. The text encoding and editorial notes were created and/or prepared by the Walt Whitman Archive and are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (CC BY 4.0). Any reuse of the material should credit the Walt Whitman Archive. Permission to reproduce the graphic images of the original item has been granted by the owners of the original for this publication only.

notesStmt.note: This manuscript was likely written between November 1864, the date mentioned in the note, and January 24, 1865, when Whitman returned from Brooklyn to Washington, D.C. Lt. Benjamin Middleton was actually killed on September 29, 1864.
Whitman's notes on Benjamin Middleton are written on a single sheet of paper that has been folded in half, thus creating four pages out of the single sheet. Three of the pages are blank.
The following are responsible for particular readings or for changes to this file, as noted: Brett Barney Tim Jackson Ashley Lawson Elizabeth Lorang

revisionDesc.change: changed the first word from a head to an ab
corrections made based on additional review by KP, BB, and EL

div1.ab: was a brave fellow—had more friends & was better liked than any other officer in the regiment—was sent home & buried here
